summary: E-commerce V2 Testing Complete - Fixed product routing bug, all V2 APIs working

issues: Category icons (Smartphone, Laptop, etc.) showing React casing warnings in console - cosmetic issue

passed_tests: Health Check API - returns status ok
Categories V2 Tree API (/api/v2/categories/tree) - returns tree structure
Catalog V2 API (/api/v2/catalog) - returns products with pagination
Catalog price filter (min_price, max_price) - working
Catalog in_stock filter - working
Catalog sorting (popular, price_asc, price_desc) - working
Catalog pagination (page, limit) - working
Catalog filters endpoint (/api/v2/catalog/filters) - returns brands and price_range
Search suggest API (/api/v2/search/suggest) - returns suggestions
Search full API (/api/v2/search) - returns paginated results
Auth login API (/api/auth/login) - works with valid credentials
Auth login rejects invalid credentials - returns 401
Auth me requires authentication - returns 401/403
Products list API (/api/products) - returns products
Product detail API (/api/products/{id}) - returns product details
Related products API (/api/v2/products/{id}/related) - working
Cart API requires authentication - returns 401/403
Homepage loads with Y-store branding and categories
Catalog page shows 43 products with filters and sorting
Product page loads correctly with gallery, price, buy buttons
Login page has email, password inputs and Google login button
Account page redirects unauthenticated users to login

bugs_fixed.bug: Product card links using /products/{id} instead of /product/{id}
bugs_fixed.description: Changed all product links from /products/ to /product/ to match React Router configuration

critical_code_review_comments: Console warnings about React component casing (Smartphone, Laptop icons) - should use PascalCase or lowercase
Some 404 errors on resources like /api/v2/cabinet/wishlist for unauthenticated users - expected behavior
context_for_next_testing_agent: All V2 features tested and working. Product routing bug fixed - links now use /product/{id} instead of /products/{id}. Backend APIs all pass. Login functionality present but test user may not exist in DB - registration might be needed for full auth testing.
